Vice President Venkaiah Naidu thanked Prime Minister Narendra Modi for making ancient Indian traditions like Yoga popular globally. Without naming any specific community or country, Naidu said a child told him she can't do ‘surya namaskar’. “I said toh chandra namaskar kar lo, beta,” said Naidu.

The moon symbolizes the Muslim community and Islamic nations have it on their flags.

Title: Chandigarh evaluated as progressive UT in energy efficiency index
Content:
This story is from January 11, 2020

CHANDIGARH: The city has been evaluated as progressive UT in the ‘State Energy Efficiency Index 2019’, which was released on Friday, by Raj Kumar Singh, minister of state (independent charge) for power and new and renewable energy. The index tracks the progress of energy efficiency (EE) initiatives in 36 states and UTs based on 97 indicators. The index was released on the occasion of RPM (Review, Planning and Monitoring) meeting was held in Delhi.

The index is developed by the Bureau of Energy Efficiency in association with Alliance for an Energy Efficient Economy. It will help states and UTs to contribute towards national goals on energy security and climate action by helping drive EE policies and programme implementation at the state and local level, tracking progress in managing the states and India’s energy footprint and institutionalising the data capture and monitoring of EE activities by states.

The report stated, “Adoption of electric vehicles in public transportation by states is at an incipient stage. States like Gujarat, Himachal Pradesh, Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Telangana and Uttar Pradesh, have incorporated electric buses in their fleet as a pilot initiative. On penetration of electric passenger vehicles (number of electric and hybrid vehicles sold between 2014-15 and 2018-19 as a percentage of total vehicles registered during the same period), Kerala tops the states at 2.3% compared to the national average of 0.3%. Chandigarh and Dadra & Nagar Haveli are two other UTs with EV penetration of more than 1%”.

UT working on promoting e-vehicles

The administration is also working on promoting hybrid and electric vehicles. Three years ago, a team of the transport department had visited Nagpur to study charging stations’ set-up. Nagpur was the first city in the country to have in place electric vehicle charging stations. Chandigarh has the highest density of vehicles in India with around 12 lakh registered ones, including two-wheelers and fourwheelers. The number of vehicles per house on an average is two, which has led to a sharp deterioration in air quality.

To cut down the pollution level, Chandigarh Transport Undertaking (CTU) will induct electric buses. At present, around 3,000 e-rickshaws are plying in the city.

For rational comparison, states/UTs are grouped into four groups based on aggregated Total Primary Energy Supply (TPES) required to meet the state’s actual energy demand (electricity, coal, oil, gas) across sectors. TPES grouping shall help states compare performance and share best practices within their peer group. Under four categories based on TPES, Haryana, Kerala, Karnataka, Maharashtra, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Puducherry and Chandigarh have been evaluated as progressive states/UTs in the State Energy Efficiency Index 2019.

Title: Indore: Thieves break into house, make away with jewellery worth lakhs
Content:
This story is from January 11, 2020

Representative image

INDORE: Unidentified persons broke into house number 55C in Tejaji Nagar and made away with cash and jewellery worth lakhs on Friday. The house is adjacent to 54C owned by CK Patle, retired SP of central excise and customs which was ransacked in September this year. Three masked men had barged into the house of the retired CK Patle in Brijnayni colony of Tejaji Nagar and had fled with jewellery and cash worth Rs 3 lakh.

In a similar incident, the accused broke into the house of one Ajay Mishra, a businessman, and stole cash and jewellery and ransacked the house. Mishra was out for work and his wife, a teacher was also at school when the incident took place.

When the wife returned home in the afternoon she saw the lock broken and items missing following which they approached Tejaji Nagar police.

Officials said that a case has been registered and they were looking at CCTV footage of nearby areas to ascertain identity of accused but there is a suspicion that the accused were tribals from Dhar district .

In September, the accused had broken into Patle’s house around 3.30 am, when his wife Sheela was sleeping in the bedroom on the ground floor, while CK Patle was sleeping in the bedroom on first floor. When Sheela got up at around 3.30 am, she found three men with covered faces and rods in their hands in her bedroom on ground floor searching for valuables. They threatened to kill her if she tried to call for help. The woman kept sitting on her bed and after the accused left, she raised alarm. Tejaji Nagar police had in November arrested the accused.

Title: Pune: Architect discharged, structural engineer spared of culpable homicide charge
Content:
This story is from January 11, 2020

A 29-year-old software analyst was killed in the collapse of the six-storied ‘Pitaram Complex’ building, while... Read More

PUNE: A sessions court has discharged the architect and dropped the charge of culpable homicide not amounting to murder against the structural engineer of the Narhe building that collapsed on October 31, 2014.

A 29-year-old software analyst was killed in the collapse of the six-storied ‘Pitaram Complex’ building, while eight families who had purchased/rented flats in the scheme were rendered homeless.

Additional sessions judge GP Agrawal, in an order on Thursday, said the structural engineer, Bal Kulkarni, be tried for the offence under Section 304-A (causing death by negligence) of the Indian Penal Code (IPC).

“Section 304-A carries a lesser punishment of up to two years as against the maximum sentence of life term provided in Section 304-II (culpable homicide not amounting to murder) of the IPC in case of a conviction,” Kulkarni’s lawyer Rohit Dangare told TOI.

In case of architect Shekhar alias Shankar Dnyanoba Whalekar, the court held that his role was limited up to preparation of the plan and obtaining necessary approval. “That, quality of construction work, structural stability, use of material of construction does not come within the domain of architect. There is no material to show that, accused number five (Whalekar) conspired with the other accused to cheat and in furtherance of the same forged documents to benefit himself and committed offence of culpable homicide,” judge Agrawal observed.

Two partners of realty firm VK Associates, which had constructed the building, a labour contractor and the land owners were among total seven persons booked in the case. It is the police’s case that the building was constructed in violation of building rules and bye laws. The police then invoked charges under sections 304 (culpable homicide), 308 (attempt to commit culpable homicide), 420 (cheating), 427 (mischief causing damage to property), 467, 468 and 471 (all related to forgery) and 120-B (conspiracy) of the IPC. All the seven accused are out on bail.

Whalekar and Kulkarni had filed separate pleas for discharge from the case, citing various grounds contesting their culpability in the case.

Their lawyers, Sachin Jadhav and Dangare, had cited the Supreme Court’s observation in the Keshub Mahindra vs State of MP case relating to the Bhopal Gas Tragedy, in which it was held that even after taking the entire material in the chargesheet at its face value, and assuming it to be representing correct factual position in connection with the operation of the plant, still there was no prima facie case for framing a charge in respect of an offence punishable under Section 304-II IPC and, that, a prima facie case existed only in respect of an offence punishable under Section 304-A IPC.

Referring to the arguments and evidence on record, judge Agrawal held that the ratio laid down in the Bhopal Gas Tragedy case, squarely applied to the instant case and held that the structural engineer cannot be tried for offence under Section 304-II, but be prosecuted for offence under Section 304-A. Since, the architect’s role was limited to preparing and getting the plan sanctioned, he got the benefit of discharge from the case.

Title: Pune: Tour firm employees booked for cheating
Content:
This story is from January 11, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: The directors and office-bearers of a tour company were booked on Thursday on the charge of duping 17 people of Rs20.85 lakh on the pretext of arranging overseas tours and offering lucrative returns on their investment in the firm.

The action was taken after an investor, Vishwajit Yenkikar (36) of Vadgaon Budruk, lodged an FIR with the Alankar police. Yenkikar had invested Rs2.65 lakh in the company. The firm’s representatives were unavailable when Yenkikar tried to contact them in the first week of January to check the status of his investment and the promised benefits, the officer said.

“Prima facie probed revealed that the suspects had taken money from 17 people. They have been accepting money from December 2018. In the first week of January, they shut their office in Kothrud and fled,” assistant inspector Shivprasad Khose of the Alankar police said.

The suspects have been booked under sections 420 (cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property) and 406 (criminal breach of trust) of the Indian Penal Code .

“The suspects had started their office in Kothrud in 2018. Their sales representative used to contact people and lure them into investing in their company by offering domestic and overseas tour packages. They also promised other privilege benefits,” Khose said.

The tour operator failed to fulfil the commitment and did not return the booking amount, the assistant inspector said.

“We have launched a search for them,” Khose added.

Title: SC/ST candidates not given time: Congress
Content:
This story is from January 11, 2020

Congress president N Uttam Kumar Reddy

HYDERABAD: Telangana Congress president N Uttam Kumar Reddy on Friday said the January 22 municipal election is the best opportunity to teach TRS a fitting lesson for its failures.

He said candidates belonging to SC, ST, BC and minority communities in nearly 3,000 wards have not been given sufficient time to procure caste and other certificates. A candidate needs to submit 12 certificates along with nomination papers. “A conspiracy has been hatched to prevent opposition parties from contesting the municipal elections,” he alleged.

Title: 10,000 student suicides in 2018, highest in 10 yrs
Content:
This story is from January 11, 2020

BENGALURU: Twenty-eight students on an average committed suicide every 24 hours during 2018, the highest in a decade in which India lost nearly 82,000 of them, according to a National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) data analysis. Of the 81,758 students who committed suicide from January 1, 2009 to December 31, 2018, 57% killed themselves in the past five years, including 10,159 in 2018, the data revealed.

Overall, India saw 1.3 lakh suicides in 2018, of which students made up for 8%, almost the same as those involved in the farming sector, while 10% of them were unemployed people. A quarter of the student suicides in 2018 were because of "failure in exams". Experts said causes ranged from drugs to depression, to broken families and breakups.

While psychologists say clinical depression, schizophrenia and other mental health issues and addiction to drugs and alcohol are the three most common reasons, sociologists and rights activists call it a psycho-social problem.

Sociologist Samata Deshmane pointed out that people, especially students, are finding it difficult to cope with the transformation in society. Arguing that human beings are "social animals", she said, "But today, we are less social and more individualists."

State-wise analysis of student suicides in 2018 shows that just five of them - Maharashtra (1,448), Tamil Nadu (953), Madhya Pradesh (862), Karnataka (755) and West Bengal (609) - account for 45%, or 4,627 cases.

Between 2014 and 2018, the same five states, along with Chhattisgarh in two years, have accounted for the highest number of cases.

Child Rights Trust director Nagasimha G Rao argues that students, especially those over the age of 10, don't have avenues to vent, which makes it difficult to manage stress. Dr M S Dharmendra, consultant psychiatrist, Manasa Neuropsychiatric Hospital, had earlier told TOI there are multiple factors, including sociological, psychological and biological factors.

"It all depends on how they are able to handle stress, how they perceive a situation. There are biological factors too as we are all born with certain predispositions to depression," he said.

Our genetic makeup gives us some vulnerability to depression. Some have low vulnerability and in a few others it may be high," he said.

Title: Ahmedabad-Pune SpiceJet flight diverted after ‘runway closure’
Content:
This story is from January 11, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: An Ahmedabad-Pune SpiceJet flight was diverted to Mumbai on Thursday evening following “temporary closure of the runway” at the city airport, resulting in three-hour delay.

“SpiceJet Flight SG 523 operating from Ahmedabad to Pune on January 9 was diverted to Mumbai due to temporary runway closure at the Pune airport . The flight reached the destination after the runway was available for normal operations,” a SpiceJet spokesperson told TOI.

The runway of the Pune airport is managed by the Indian Air Force (IAF), authorities of which could not be reached for their comments on the issue till going to the press.

The flight took off from Ahmedabad at 7.28pm, eight-minute after its scheduled departure.

It was supposed to land at the Pune airport by 8.20pm, following which it was to fly back to Ahmedabad as SG-524 at 8.50pm.

A passenger travelling by the return Pune-Ahmedabad flight said, “The flight (SG-524) was supposed to take off from the Pune airport at 8.50pm. However, it was delayed by three hours and eventually took off at 11.50pm.”

“The airline staffers kept giving us all kinds of excuses for the delay. They also behaved rudely with many passengers,” the passenger said.

The runway of the Pune airport is generally closed from 8am to 10.30am every day to facilitate operations of IAF.

On Saturdays, the runway is shut from 11am to 5am for maintenance. Only on rare occasions, the IAF shuts the runway down at any time other than the ones mentioned above.

No other flight reported any diversion during the alleged runway closure time.

Title: BJP workers rough up secretary of Jalgaon unit
Content:
This story is from January 11, 2020

Sunil Nave (with black ink on his shirt) after the attack

NASHIK: A section of irked BJP workers allegedly heckled and threw black ink on the organisational secretary of the Jalgaon unit of the party, Sunil Nave, in presence of Union minister Raosaheb Danve and former state water resources minister Girish Mahajan.

The 17-member core committee of the Jalgaon district BJP and party workers had gathered at a hall in Jalgaon city on Friday afternoon for the election of the new Jalgaon district (rural) president.

Nave told TOI that at about 2pm, when the process to decide the new district (rural) party chief kicked off, some party workers suddenly rushed to the dais, where the core committee members were sitting, and started raising slogans against him.

The core committee includes Danve, Mahajan, two local MPs, current and former MLAs from the district. However, former revenue minister Eknath Khadse, who is also a part of the core team, was not present.

Nave said that these irked party members were anguished that they were not considered for the post of the Bhusawal city president although they had filed their applications for the post. The new BJP city president was appointed about a week back.

“They thought that I was instrumental in ignoring their candidatures. Suddenly, they climbed onto the dais and started beating me. While I was reasoning with them, they suddenly threw black ink on me. There was utter chaos at the venue. They had come prepared to target me in the meeting,” said Nave, adding that Danve and Mahajan witnessed the happening.

There were about 11 BJP candidates who were interested for the post for the Bhusawal city president. “However, the core committee decided to appoint Dinesh Namade for that post, although he did not file application. I had no role in finalising the candidate for that post,” he claimed.

As utter chaos unfolded, Mahajan came down from the dais and pacified the annoyed party workers. Nave has not lodged any police complaint so far stating that it was internal matter of the party.

“Danve has taken strong exception about the development and he has assured those responsible would be expelled from the party,” added Nave.

Later, the core committee had a meeting and decided to appoint former MLA from Raver, Haribhau Jawale, as the new district (rural) president of the party.

Title: Centenary saplings on Lucknow University campus: Planted in November, only two surviving
Content:
This story is from January 11, 2020

A sapling on the verge of perishing on LU campus

LUCKNOW: A hundred saplings of peepal and neem planted on the grounds of Lucknow University to mark its centenary celebrations did not last even for 100 days, thanks to the negligence of university authorities.

Planted on November 25, LU’s foundation day, only two of 100 saplings have survived, revealed a reality check by TOI on Friday.

While planting these saplings, university professors had taken an oath to take care of them and make LU the greenest educational campus in the city. However, 98 saplings planted in the parking lot opposite physics and chemistry departments and Canning College building have dried up.

The two which survived include one at gate number two that was planted under the shade of a big tree. The other one was opposite the political science department where a tea stall vendor keeps watering the plant regularly.

“Most saplings dried because they were not planted properly. Rather than digging deep enough to accommodate roots before levelling it with mud, the plantation was done superficially. As a result, most dried within a few days. Some in the parking lot were crushed by the movement of vehicles,” said a parking lot attendant at gate number two. A senior professor, admitting negligence in care of plants, said, “The decision of plantation was taken in haste by the university authorities at the eleventh hour because no other event was planned for the centenary year foundation day on November 25.”

LU spokesperson Sanjay Medhavi said there was laxity in care of plantation. However, he said this would not be repeated. “LU has planned to plant 2,600 saplings on Republic Day on the main and second campuses. This time, teachers and students will be given responsibility individually to take care of plants,” he said.

Title: Madras HC asks DVAC to file status report on corpn tender row
Content:
This story is from January 11, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: The Madras high court on Friday directed the Directorate of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption ( DVAC ) to file a status report on the preliminary inquiry conducted on its complaint alleging corruption by the Greater Chennai Corporation in awarding tenders for paving roads and constructing storm water drains across the city.

A division bench of Justice M Sathyanarayanan and Justice R Hemalatha passed the interim order on a public interest litigation (PIL) moved by Arappor Iyakkam, a non-governmental organisation (NGO), seeking to register an FIR against the commissioner based on its complaint. The bench also directed the NGO to add local administration minister S P Velumani as a respondent since the corporation comes under his portfolio and adjourned the case to February 19 for further hearing.

Arappor Iyakkam’s PIL said it had lodged a complaint with the DVAC on November 1, 2108, seeking criminal action against the corporation commissioner for alleged violations in awarding tenders for relaying 3,800 existing bus route roads and internal roads at an estimated Rs 300 crore.

Since no action was taken even a year after the completion of the project, the NGO moved the present plea.

In its submission, the DVAC said the preliminary inquiry began on March 11, 2019, and sought time to file a status report. Earlier, the NGO said the authorities also committed a fraud in pricing. The tender was awarded on the condition that river sand would be used. However, all the work was done with the much cheaper M-sand, it added, urging the court to constitute a special investigation team to probe the case and to monitor it.

Title: Mrunal Thakur wishes her 'Super 30' co-star Hrithik Roshan on his birthday with a sweet post!
Content: Recently, Kareena Kapoor Khan announced the big breaking news of her second pregnancy with hubby Saif Ali Khan. While fans, friends, and family of the gorgeous diva seem to be growing impatient for the upcoming little bundle of joy who’s expected to arrive by late February to March 2021, one must also recall Bebo’s first pregnancy days when she was carrying her munchkin, Taimur Ali Khan. No doubt, she was a complete stunner in her first pregnancy glow, meanwhile, if the actress is looking for some inspiration for her second round, here’s a list of five celebrities from whom Bebo can take fashion inspirations to ace her maternity look once again. From the supermodel, Gigi Hadid to ace singers like Katy Perry and Beyonce, this list covers some of the most fashionable mommies and mummy-to-be.Photo credit: Instagram

Title: Photos: Deepika Padukone looks beautiful in a brown jumpsuit as she promotes 'Chhapaak' on Salman Khan' show
Content: Deepika Padukone's 'Chhapaak' been the talk of the town since the announcement. The trailer of the film receieved appreciation and love from the audience. The film has hit the theatres and is receiving a good response. Deepika's performance is being praised by the viewers along with the other star cast.Now, Deepika who has been promoting the film on various platforms stepped out for to promote the film on Salman Khan 's reality show. For the occasion, the actress decided to go with a brown jumpsuit and high heels. The actress looked pretty as she left her hair open and opted for a minimum makeup for her promotional outing.Deepika was all smiles as the paparazzi clicked her pictures on the sets of the show.Check it out here:Meanwhile, 'Chhapaak' is based on the life of the acid attack survivor Laxmi Agarwal . Helmed by Meghna Gulzar and backed by Deepika herself, the film also stars Vikrant Massey in a pivotal role.It has locked horns with Ajay Devgn 's 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' and Ranjinikanth's 'Darbar'.
